alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 9:33AM EDT until August 25 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Lorain and Erie Counties. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Vermilion River Near Vermilion. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Lowland flooding will occur in Mill Hollow Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 01/18/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EDT.
